""Iranians are exceptionally nationalistic about map boundaries compared to most populations, especially in the Middle East and other post-colonial regions.

We view our borders as ancient, not colonial, and take pride in the fact that they were not externally engineered in the twentieth century.

It is our civilizational inheritance.

It is not an overstatement to say that if Iranâ€™s territorial integrity were ever seriously threatened, you would see monarchists, reformists, hardliners, etc., standing arm in arm to defend the country.

I have monarchist friends whom I know for a fact would get on a plane and risk imprisonment to offer themselves up to defend Iran.

For them, doing anything else would be unfathomable.

I feel the same way."
"
--------------

He speaks in a fictional â€˜weâ€™ that exists only in Persian nationalist imagination, not in Iranâ€™s lived reality. As a Sunni Iranian, this is immediately obvious, and it is obvious to anyone inside Iran who is not mainstream Persian. This includes even Shia groups who have largely lost a distinct identity and have been absorbed into Persian nationalism, such as many Azeris, Lors, and Caspian Iranians. 

This constant talk about Iran being uniquely special with natural borders is not some shared civilisational instinct. It is a standard modern Iranian nationalist myth, repeated so relentlessly that the average Iranian mistakes it for ancient truth, they actually believe they are special not realising they are not even the oldest civilisation in the Middle East. 

The irony is that both camps, i.e. Khomeinists and Shahists  that pretend to oppose each other fully embrace it Persian nationalist fairy tales. Yes, zealot hardcore  Khomeinists, the ideological heirs of the Safavids, and monarchists are united at the core. They quarrel over aesthetics, turbans versus crowns, but the substance is identical. Questioning the current borders is treated like apostasy, as if Iran itself were sacred. For many of them, it genuinely is, worshipped alongside God if not above Him (even in their everyday language one can observe that).

Everyone can destroy them with basic historical facts: the claim about ancient natural borders is laughable. It is pure myth making and cope on steroids. Geography has never magically produced legitimate states. Mountains and deserts were never sacred civilisational walls. They were zones of movement, trade, war, and overlap. The Zagros was a corridor for Arabs, Kurds, Lurs, Elamites (who were not Iranian in any ethnic sense), and Mesopotamian peoples for thousands of years. It was never a holy Iranian fence. Pretending otherwise is modern nationalist projection read backwards into history. But try to clarify these basics to them and they chimp out. 

Tey to explain to them that
Iranâ€™s current borders did not descend from antiquity. They were violently hammered into shape under the  Safavids (Khomeini and Khamenei's salaf i.e. predecessors) and later reinforced by Qajar and Pahlavi centralisation through war, forced assimilation, and sectarian coercion as I already mentioned. Even when the rulers were Turco Persian, like the Safavids and Qajars, the project remained Persian nationalist and Shia supremacist, using sect and Persian identity to crush minorities, especially Sunnis. Borders shifted constantly and Sunnis and non Persian peoples were absorbed by force, not consent. For Sunnis, Kurds, Baloch, Arabs, and others, these borders were never inherited with pride. Never. They were imposed with blood, exclusion, and humiliation. This is precisely why both Khomeinists and Pahlavists are rightfully deeply resented among these communities.

What is telling is that this Iranian nationalist arrogance comes from insecurity. A multi ethnic state that does not match its ethnic or linguistic reality needs a myth of inevitability to survive. So conquest is rebranded as geography and coercion as civilisation. Older Middle Eastern peoples do not need this fantasy to justify themselves. Iranian nationalism does, because without it the entire story collapses.

The idea that monarchists, reformists, and hardliners would all unite to defend this map only proves the point. Different costumes, same ideology.

What makes this worse is not ignorant masses repeating these myths, but an Iranian elite that actively manufactures and teaches them to children as unquestionable fact. I heard these fairy tales constantly growing up, alongside open contempt for Arabs and Afghans and absurd fantasies about Iran belonging next to Austria and Switzerland. This is not pride. It is denial dressed up as history.

To add one more thing: Iranian nationalists always ignore is a map they can never answer. The average Iranian is not even aware of this basic fact, and once you see it, the fairy tale of a uniquely ordained Iran with natural borders uniting Aryans since antiquity collapses. But as a starter, Iranian speaking peoples did not even originate on the Iranian plateau at all. They migrated into it. Before them, the Elamites were already there, non Iranian in language and identity, with a civilisation LONG predating the arrival of Iranians. The same applies to Kurds, who long predate the modern Iranian state and were later absorbed into a Persian nationalist project they never consented to.
The geology alone destroys the myth. The Arabian plate penetrates deep into what is now called Iran. Ahwaz, historically known as Arabistan even under the Safavids, sits on the Arabian plate, not the Iranian microcontinent. That is why its climate, landscape, and historical orientation align with Mesopotamia and Arabia, not the Persian heartlands. This is not ideology. It is geology. These are factsz simple as.
The same fantasy is imposed on Kurdish lands. The Zagros was never a sacred Persian boundary. It was a zone of movement and autonomy for Kurds and other highland peoples, later subdued through conquest and centralisation.

So when Iranian nationalists talk about natural borders, what they really mean is simple. These are territories they conquered early enough that they now pretend geography itself demanded it. This is not destiny. It is conquest rewritten as nature.

And whosoever disbelieves, then Allaah is indeed Self-Sufficient, not in need of any of the creation

And whosoever is ungrateful, then Allaah is indeed All-Rich Free of need, Worthy of all praise

"Today, No one can push one of the schoolsâ€™ views to make it as the only way of seeing religion in Saudi Arabia. But today, we are back on the right track, as I said," he added.

"We are going back to the roots, back to pure Islam, to be sure that the soul of Saudi Arabia, based on Islam, our culture, whether tribal, or urban , is serving the nation , serving the people, serving the region, serving the whole world, and is leading us to economic growth. You see it now with your eyes in Saudi Arabia. Just come and check it out, and watch the videos of Saudi Arabia six or seven years ago. We did a lot, and there are a few things still to do. And we are going to work to make them happen.""
